014package org.jdbi.v3.vavr;
015
016import io.vavr.Tuple;
017import org.jdbi.v3.core.config.ConfigRegistry;
018import org.jdbi.v3.core.config.JdbiConfig;
019import org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.MapEntryConfig;
020import org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.MapEntryMappers;
021
022/**
023 * Mappers similar to {@link org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.MapEntryMappers} but map entries in vavr are in fact
024 * of type {@link io.vavr.Tuple2}.
025 */
026public class TupleMappers implements JdbiConfig<TupleMappers>, MapEntryConfig<TupleMappers> {
027
028    private static final int KEY_COLUMN_TUPLE_INDEX = 1;
029    private static final int VALUE_COLUMN_TUPLE_INDEX = 2;
030
031    private ConfigRegistry registry;
032
033    private String[] columns = new String[Tuple.MAX_ARITY];
034
035    public TupleMappers() {}
036
037    private TupleMappers(TupleMappers that) {
038        System.arraycopy(that.columns, 0, this.columns, 0, Tuple.MAX_ARITY);
039    }
040
041    @Override
042    public String getKeyColumn() {
043        String column = getColumn(KEY_COLUMN_TUPLE_INDEX);
044        if (column == null) {
045            // fallback to global map key config
046            return this.registry.get(MapEntryMappers.class).getKeyColumn();
047        }
048        return column;
049    }
050
051    @Override
052    public TupleMappers setKeyColumn(String keyColumn) {
053        return setColumn(KEY_COLUMN_TUPLE_INDEX, keyColumn);
054    }
055
056    @Override
057    public String getValueColumn() {
058        String column = getColumn(VALUE_COLUMN_TUPLE_INDEX);
059        if (column == null) {
060            // fallback to global map value config
061            return this.registry.get(MapEntryMappers.class).getValueColumn();
062        }
063        return column;
064    }
065
066    @Override
067    public TupleMappers setValueColumn(String valueColumn) {
068        return setColumn(VALUE_COLUMN_TUPLE_INDEX, valueColumn);
069    }
070
071    /**
072     * Names a specific column in the mapper.
073     *
074     * @param tupleIndex the 1 based index of the TupleX. as in _1, _2 etc.
075     * @param name       the column name to be mapped explicitly
076     * @return Config object for chaining
077     */
078    public TupleMappers setColumn(int tupleIndex, String name) {
079        columns[tupleIndex - 1] = name;
080        return this;
081    }
082
083    /**
084     * Returns the name for a column.
085     *
086     * @param tupleIndex the 1 based index of the TupleX. as in _1, _2 etc.
087     * @return the column name to be mapped explicitly
088     */
089    public String getColumn(int tupleIndex) {
090        return columns[tupleIndex - 1];
091    }
092
093    @Override
094    public TupleMappers createCopy() {
095        return new TupleMappers(this);
096    }
097
098    @Override
099    public void setRegistry(ConfigRegistry registry) {
100        this.registry = registry;
101    }
102}
